description.zh-cn: 南北朝时代南梁开国皇帝，庙号高祖。原为南齐宗室，后篡齐建梁。在位近48年，晚年笃信佛教，因侯景之乱被囚禁饿死。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Liang dynasty during the Northern and Southern dynasties period, with the temple name Gaozu. Originally a member of the Southern Qi imperial clan, he usurped the throne and established the Liang dynasty. He reigned for nearly 48 years, became a devout Buddhist in his later years, and was imprisoned and starved to death during the Hou Jing Rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 中国南北朝时期的南朝第三个朝代，由梁武帝萧衍建立。
description.en: The third of the Southern Dynasties in China during the Northern and Southern dynasties period, founded by Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍第三子，南梁第二位皇帝。
description.en: The third son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan, and the second emperor of the Liang dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 南齐官员，梁武帝萧衍之父，被追尊为太祖文皇帝。
description.en: An official of the Southern Qi dynasty and the father of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan. He was posthumously honored as Emperor Wen.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍之母，被追尊为文献皇后。
description.en: The mother of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan. She was posthumously honored as Empress Wenxian.

description.zh-cn: 中国南北朝时期的南朝第二个朝代。
description.en: The second of the Southern Dynasties in China during the Northern and Southern dynasties period.

description.zh-cn: 南朝齐武帝永明时期，以竟陵王萧子良为中心的文学群体。
description.en: A literary group centered around Xiao Ziliang, the Prince of Jingling, during the Yongming era of Emperor Wu of Southern Qi.

description.zh-cn: 南齐末代皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Southern Qi dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 世界三大宗教之一。
description.en: One of the world's major religions.

description.zh-cn: 南朝梁末年由东魏降将侯景发动的军事叛乱，导致南梁的崩溃。
description.en: A military rebellion launched by the defected Eastern Wei general Hou Jing during the late years of the Liang dynasty, which led to the dynasty's collapse.

description.zh-cn: 原为东魏将领，后叛投南梁，再起兵反梁，发动侯景之乱。
description.en: Originally a general of Eastern Wei, he later defected to the Liang dynasty and then rebelled against it, initiating the Hou Jing Rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍的长兄。
description.en: The eldest brother of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 南齐的第六位皇帝，以暴虐著称。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Southern Qi dynasty, known for his tyranny.

description.zh-cn: 南齐宗室，与萧衍一同起兵反对萧宝卷。
description.en: A member of the Southern Qi imperial clan who, along with Xiao Yan, rose in rebellion against Xiao Baojuan.

description.zh-cn: 南朝梁时期位于都城建康的著名佛寺，梁武帝曾四次在此舍身出家。
description.en: A famous Buddhist temple in the capital Jiankang during the Liang dynasty, where Emperor Wu renounced secular life four times.

description.zh-cn: 中国本土创立的传统宗教。
description.en: A traditional religion indigenous to China.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝于天监三年（504年）颁布的诏书，宣布舍弃道教，归依佛教。
description.en: An edict issued by Emperor Wu of Liang in 504 (the third year of the Tianjian era), announcing his abandonment of Taoism in favor of Buddhism.

description.zh-cn: 南朝道教思想家、医学家，与梁武帝关系密切，有“山中宰相”之称。
description.en: A Taoist thinker and physician of the Southern Dynasties, who had a close relationship with Emperor Wu of Liang and was known as the 'Prime Minister in the Mountains'.

description.zh-cn: 印度佛教僧侣，被尊为中国禅宗的初祖。
description.en: An Indian Buddhist monk, revered as the first patriarch of Zen Buddhism in China.

en: Edict on Abstaining from Alcohol and Meat

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝颁布的禁止僧众食肉的法令，开启了汉传佛教素食的传统。
description.en: An edict issued by Emperor Wu of Liang prohibiting monks and nuns from eating meat, which initiated the tradition of vegetarianism in Chinese Buddhism.

description.zh-cn: 指在中国汉族地区流传、发展的佛教宗派，是佛教三大地理分支之一。
description.en: Refers to the schools of Buddhism that spread and developed in the Han Chinese regions, one of the three major geographical branches of Buddhism.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍的元配妻子。
description.en: The first wife of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍的贵嫔。
description.en: A noble consort (Guipin) of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍的长子，昭明太子。
description.en: The eldest son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan, known as Crown Prince Zhaoming.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍第五子，封庐陵威王。
description.en: The fifth son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan, enfeoffed as the Prince Wei of Luling.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍第七子，南梁第四位皇帝。
description.en: The seventh son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan, and the fourth emperor of the Liang dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝萧衍的修容，生梁元帝萧绎。
description.en: A consort (Xiurong) of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan, and the mother of Emperor Yuan, Xiao Yi.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍迫使南齐和帝禅位，建立南梁，成为开国皇帝。
description.en: Xiao Yan forced Emperor He of Southern Qi to abdicate, established the Liang dynasty, and became its founding emperor.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍作为南梁的开国皇帝，在位时间近48年。
description.en: As the founding emperor of the Liang dynasty, Xiao Yan reigned for nearly 48 years.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍是萧顺之的儿子。
description.en: Xiao Yan was the son of Xiao Shunzhi.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍是张尚柔的儿子。
description.en: Xiao Yan was the son of Zhang Shangrou.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍年轻时是竟陵王萧子良门下的文学群体“竟陵八友”之一。
description.en: In his youth, Xiao Yan was one of the 'Eight Friends of Jingling', a literary group under Xiao Ziliang, the Prince of Jingling.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍出身于南齐宗室，并在南齐担任过建阳县男、建安郡公、梁公、梁王等职务。
description.en: Xiao Yan was from the imperial clan of Southern Qi and held positions such as Baron of Jianyang County, Duke of Jian'an Commandery, Duke of Liang, and Prince of Liang.

description.zh-cn: 萧衍迫使南齐和帝萧宝融禅位，并于次日将其赐死。
description.en: Xiao Yan forced Emperor He of Southern Qi, Xiao Baorong, to abdicate the throne and had him put to death the next day.

description.zh-cn: 在侯景之乱中，都城建康被围，梁武帝萧衍最终在饥渴交加中去世。
description.en: During the Hou Jing Rebellion, the capital Jiankang was besieged, and Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan, eventually died of starvation and thirst.

description.zh-cn: 侯景起兵叛乱，围困建康，削减梁武帝的饮食，最终导致其死亡。
description.en: Hou Jing launched a rebellion, besieged Jiankang, and reduced Emperor Wu's food supplies, ultimately leading to his death.

description.zh-cn: 太清元年（547年），梁武帝接纳了东魏叛将侯景的投靠，并任命其为大将军、封河南王。
description.en: In 547, Emperor Wu of Liang accepted the surrender of the defecting Eastern Wei general Hou Jing, appointing him Grand General and Prince of Henan.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝同意东魏用萧渊明交换侯景的提议，导致侯景感到被出卖，遂起兵叛乱。
description.en: Emperor Wu of Liang agreed to Eastern Wei's proposal to exchange Hou Jing for Xiao Yuanming, which made Hou Jing feel betrayed and led him to launch a rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 永元二年（500年），萧懿被诬告谋反，遭东昏侯萧宝卷赐死。
description.en: In 500, Xiao Yi was falsely accused of treason and was ordered to commit suicide by Emperor Xiao Baojuan.

description.zh-cn: 在其兄萧懿被萧宝卷杀害后，萧衍积极招兵，举兵推翻萧宝卷的统治。
description.en: After his brother Xiao Yi was killed by Xiao Baojuan, Xiao Yan actively recruited soldiers and raised an army to overthrow Xiao Baojuan's rule.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝晚年笃信佛法，多次舍身出家，倾力资助佛教发展，颁布《断酒肉文》，使南朝佛教达到鼎盛。
description.en: In his later years, Emperor Wu of Liang became a devout Buddhist, repeatedly renouncing secular life to become a monk, generously funding the development of Buddhism, and issuing the 'Edict on Abstaining from Alcohol and Meat', which led to the flourishing of Buddhism in the Southern Dynasties.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝曾四次前往同泰寺舍身出家，每次均由群臣以巨款赎回。
description.en: Emperor Wu of Liang went to Tongtai Temple four times to renounce secular life, and each time he was 'ransomed' back by his ministers with a large sum of money.

description.zh-cn: 天监三年（504），萧衍颁布《舍事道法诏》，宣布舍道归佛。
description.en: In 504, Xiao Yan issued the 'Edict on Abandoning Taoism', announcing his renunciation of Taoism in favor of Buddhism.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝与道士陶弘景关系极善，常就国家大事向其请教，陶弘景因此有“山中宰相”之称。
description.en: Emperor Wu of Liang had an excellent relationship with the Taoist Tao Hongjing, often consulting him on state affairs, which earned Tao the nickname 'Prime Minister in the Mountains'.

description.zh-cn: 禅宗祖师菩提达摩来华时曾与梁武帝会谈，但因理念不合而离开。
description.en: When the Zen patriarch Bodhidharma came to China, he had a meeting with Emperor Wu of Liang, but left due to disagreements in their philosophies.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝颁布的《断酒肉文》禁止僧众吃肉，开启了汉传佛教素食的传统。
description.en: The 'Edict on Abstaining from Alcohol and Meat' issued by Emperor Wu of Liang prohibited monks and nuns from eating meat, initiating the tradition of vegetarianism in Chinese Buddhism.

description.zh-cn: 梁武帝亲自颁布了《断酒肉文》。
description.en: Emperor Wu of Liang personally issued the 'Edict on Abstaining from Alcohol and Meat'.

description.zh-cn: 萧懿是梁武帝萧衍的长兄。
description.en: Xiao Yi was the elder brother of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 郗徽是梁武帝萧衍的元配妻子。
description.en: Xi Hui was the first wife of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 丁令光是梁武帝萧衍的贵嫔。
description.en: Ding Lingguang was a noble consort (Guipin) of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 阮令嬴是梁武帝萧衍的修容。
description.en: Ruan Lingying was a consort (Xiurong) of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 萧统是梁武帝萧衍的长子。
description.en: Xiao Tong was the eldest son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 萧统是丁令光所生。
description.en: Xiao Tong was the son of Ding Lingguang.

description.zh-cn: 萧纲是梁武帝萧衍的第三子。
description.en: Xiao Gang was the third son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 萧纲是丁令光所生。
description.en: Xiao Gang was the son of Ding Lingguang.

description.zh-cn: 萧续是梁武帝萧衍的第五子。
description.en: Xiao Xu was the fifth son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 萧续是丁令光所生。
description.en: Xiao Xu was the son of Ding Lingguang.

description.zh-cn: 萧绎是梁武帝萧衍的第七子。
description.en: Xiao Yi was the seventh son of Emperor Wu of Liang, Xiao Yan.

description.zh-cn: 萧绎是阮令嬴所生。
description.en: Xiao Yi was the son of Ruan Lingying.
